description: A simple web application that acts as an interview assistant. It takes spoken or typed input, sends it to a large language model (LLM), and displays the response. It also keeps a history of conversations and allows for deeper research on responses using Perplexica.

features.name: Voice/Text Input
features.description: Accepts user input in a textarea on the main page.

features.name: Automatic Submission (Debounced)
features.description: Automatically sends the input to an LLM after a short delay of inactivity.

features.name: LLM Integration
features.description: Supports both Ollama and OpenAI as backends via a PHP proxy.

features.name: Enable/Disable Toggle
features.description: A toggle switch to control automatic submission.

features.name: Conversation History
features.description: A separate page (`history.php`) that displays a timeline of all conversations.

features.name: Dig Deeper with Perplexica
features.description: Allows users to send a response to a Perplexica instance for further research.

futureEnhancements: Persist conversation history server-side in a more robust way (e.g., SQLite).
Add user-selectable models and providers via the UI.
Implement streaming responses for lower perceived latency.
Add unit tests for the PHP backend.

fileStructure.index.php: Main application page with the input form.
fileStructure.history.php: Page to display the conversation history.
fileStructure.api/ask.php: PHP proxy to handle LLM requests and save history.
fileStructure.api/history.php: PHP endpoint to serve the conversation history.
fileStructure.api/perplexica.php: PHP proxy to handle Perplexica requests.
fileStructure.assets/js/app.js: JavaScript for the main application page.
fileStructure.project.json: This file, providing a structured overview of the project.
